fields.description:
h3. Enable dependency apps migration
Some Marketplace apps have dependencies built by the same Marketplace partner. Usually, several paid apps can rely on the same dependency apps.

Currently, CCMA and JCMA only display paid apps as part of App Assessment. Customers can only mark these apps as "Needed in Cloud", not their dependencies.

Some Marketplace partners choose to implement their migration path in those dependencies, which can't be marked as "Needed in Cloud" hence will not be triggered by the App migration platform.

Marketplace partners need a solution to allow this use case.
fields.summary: Enable dependency apps migration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When doing a test migration you have deleted a project to migrate a final time during your cutover migration, however, [projects in the trash|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/trash-for-jira-cloud-projects/] are not detected by the tool Jira Cloud Migration Assistant, and therefore, the user needs to find out if the project is in the trash and permanentely purge the project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Migrate a project from Server to Cloud using JCMA
# Delete the project in Cloud
# (Project stays in trash)
# Try to migrate the same project from JCMA server to Cloud

h3. Expected Results

JCMA would alert the user that the project is still in Cloud during it's pre-check.

h3. Actual Results

The project will fail to migrate as the same project key is already present in Jira Cloud database.

h3. Workaround

Permanentely purge the project from [Jira trash can|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/trash-for-jira-cloud-projects]. Click on the cogwheel (Settings) -> Projects -> Trash Click on the three dotted button and select delete permanentely.
fields.summary: JCMA doesn't detect projects in the trash

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When doing a Jira site import into Jira Cloud, if you have an issue that is registered in any sprints and for some reason, that issue no longer exists, the import will fail.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue
# Associate with a sprint or a assign the issue a custom field value
# Delete the issue through the database
# Create a backup
# Import the backup in Cloud

Note: Deleting the issue directly through the database in this context is just to replicate the behavior for this bug, this shouldn't be done in a production environment.

h3. Expected Results

Site import goes through.

h3. Actual Results

Jira site import fails with the following exception.

The below exception is thrown in the Jira Cloud logs:

{noformat}
Completed import stages for taskId 10071 with failure There was a problem configuring the database for import. Please contact Atlassian support. org.postgresql.util.PSQLException:

ERROR: insert or update on table "issuesprint_60db71" violates foreign key constraint "issuesprint_60db71_issue_id_fkey" Detail: Key (issue_id)=(xxxxxx) is not present in table "jiraissue".
{noformat}

OR the following stacktrace may also be seen when a custom field value is associated with a missing jira issue

{code}
Caught PSQLException for insert into "public"."AO_54307E_REQUESTTYPE_TO_ISSUE" ("ISSUE_ID", "PORTAL_KEY", "REQUEST_TYPE_KEY", "SEARCH_INDEX", "UPDATED_TIMESTAMP")
select "customfieldvalue"."issue", case when "customfieldvalue"."stringvalue" like ? then substr("customfieldvalue"."stringvalue",1,(strpos("customfieldvalue"."stringvalue",?)-1 - ?)) else ? end, case when "customfieldvalue"."stringvalue" like ? then substr("customfieldvalue"."stringvalue",(strpos("customfieldvalue"."stringvalue",?)-1 + ?)+1) when (not "customfieldvalue"."stringvalue" like ?) then "customfieldvalue"."stringvalue" else ? end, "customfieldvalue"."stringvalue", case when "customfieldvalue"."updated" is not null then EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM "customfieldvalue"."updated") * 1000 else -1 end from "public"."customfieldvalue" "customfieldvalue" where "customfieldvalue"."customfield" = ? and "customfieldvalue"."stringvalue" is not null and "customfieldvalue"."issue" is not null and "customfieldvalue"."id" in (select max("temp"."id") from "public"."customfieldvalue" "temp" where "temp"."issue" = "customfieldvalue"."issue" and "temp"."customfield" = "customfieldvalue"."customfield")com.atlassian.servicedesk.bootstrap.upgradeanddowngrade.upgradetasks.AUT_0036_RequestTypeToIssueMigrationUpgradeTask.doUpgrade(AUT_0036_RequestTypeToIssueMigrationUpgradeTask.java:61)

Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: insert or update on table "AO_54307E_REQUESTTYPE_TO_ISSUE" violates foreign key constraint "fk_ao_54307e_requesttype_to_issue_issue_id"
  Detail: Key (ISSUE_ID)=(10000) is not present in table "jiraissue".
{code}

h3. Workaround

You can find out any issues that have custom field values but don't exist anymore using the following query:

{code}
select c.issue,c.customfield,c.stringvalue,j.id 
from customfieldvalue c
join jiraissue j ON j.id = c.issue
where c.issue not in (select j.id from jiraissue);

OR

--Specific for Sprint values

select c.issue,c.customfield,c.stringvalue,j.id 
from customfieldvalue c
join jiraissue j ON j.id = c.issue
join customfield a ON a.id = c.id
where c.issue not in (select j.id from jiraissue) and a.customfieldtypekey = 'com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint';
{code}

Create a backup of Jira, extract the XML files.

Use the following grep to find the line number:

{code}
grep -in '<CustomFieldValue id="9498796"' entities.xml
{code}

Result:

{code}
153008318:    <CustomFieldValue id="9498796" ....
{code}

Use the following SED command to remove the line:

{code}
sed -i '153008318d' entities.xml
{code}

Repack the XML file into a zip, and proceed with the import on Cloud.
fields.summary: During Jira site import, if you have a deleted issue with a sprint or custom field value, the import will fail

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using CCMA - option Only users related to the selected spaces , the invalid email address and Multiple users have same email address checks are also been carried out for users who are not contributed to spaces.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Tested with CCMA version 3.20
 # Created two users with same email address and a user with invalid email address.
 # The newly created users did not contribute to any of the spaces.
 # Created a migration plan and during check for errors , the invalid email address
 and the Multiple users having same email address checks are still carried out for the users who did not contribute to any of the spaces. 
  

h3. Expected Results
 * The invalid email address and Multiple users having same email address checks should not be done for users not contributed to any space as we have selected the option *Only users related to the selected spaces* 

h3. Actual Results
 * We noticed that the users not contributed to any space being checked.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Users not contributed to spaces are checked when using option Only users related to the selected spaces.

h3. Issue Summary
When perform a Cloud -> Cloud migration, the group's description doesn't get migrated to destination Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On Jira Cloud A, create a few groups with Group's description
 # Export the site
 # Import the backup into Jira Cloud B
 # Check the group's description on Jira Cloud B

h3. Expected Results
Group's description is carried to the destination Cloud.

h3. Actual Results
Group's description is showing empty to the destination Cloud.
* Source site:
!image-1.png|thumbnail!
* Destination site:
!image-2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes:

{code}
    <Group id="10350" groupName="custom group" lowerGroupName="custom group" active="1" local="0" createdDate="2021-06-07 04:30:03.806" updatedDate="2021-06-07 04:30:12.164" description="Will Group Description retain after migration?" lowerDescription="will group description retain after migration?" type="GROUP" directoryId="1" externalId=""/>
{code}

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Publish user mappings for space-only migrations in Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a migration in Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant
 # In the *Choose what to migrate page* select *Only users related to the selected spaces*
 # Run the migration until complete
 # Using the [Mappings API|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/app-migration/rest/api-group-mapping-api/#api-mapping-transferid-page-get] retrieve the user mappings in the {{identity:user}} namespace

h3. Expected Results

The mapping of users migrated as part of the migration are returned by the API
h3. Actual Results

The mapping of users migrated as part of the migration are NOT returned by the API, for example the results look like
{code:java}
{
  "meta": {
    "pageSize": 5000,
    "hasNext": false,
    "lastEntity": null
  },
  "items": {}
} {code}
h3. Notes

Although the users do not appear in the mappings, they have been created and can be seen as active or inactive users in the user list for the associated cloud site.
h3. Workaround

In the "Choose what to migrate page" select the "All users and groups" option
fields.summary: Publish user mappings for space-only migrations in Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When running the Jira Macro Repair, a list of Server Name is detected and prompted the admin to choose the corresponding link for the update.
However, "New Jira instance link" section is required for all links and we couldn't update only 1 link.

h3. Suggested Solution
Other than the application links that we had setup on Confluence Cloud, it would be nice to have the option to choose "None" or "Skip" from the list.
!Screen Shot 2021-06-02 at 2.27.38 pm.png|thumbnail!

h3. Why this is important
* During the test migration, it would be nice to test the Jira Macro Repair with only System Jira, while we are still working on setting up the AppLink with external Jira
* Sometimes, the Jira in the macro no longer valid and we would like to skip the fix instead of forcing updating the macros
fields.summary: Ability to skip some links on Jira Macro Repair

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Cloud Migration assistant does not migrate status and priorities with a backslash in the name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a status in Jira Server / Data Center with a backslash '\' in the name. Lets call is XYZ\ABC
 # Attempt a migration with Jira Cloud Migration Assistant

h3. Expected Results
Status is migrated to cloud without any issues. 

h3. Actual Results
Status is not migrated. We seen an error in the logs similar to 
{code}project-import We couldn't import Issue Status 'XZY\ABC'. Reason: IllegalStateException: Unable to create status: Errors: {name=A status with that name already exists, please enter a different name.}
Error Messages: [].{code}

h3. Workaround
Rename the status in the source Jira instance and remove the '\'
fields.summary: Jira Cloud Migration assistant does not migrate status and priorities with a backslash in the name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On certain user default settings, the GMT timezone is not handled properly by the CSV importer

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Jira Settings > System > General Configuration
 # Set the *Default user time zone* to America/Los Angeles
 # Import a date time custom field value via CSV.

Value : {{11-04-18 09:01 GMT}}
Importer Date Format : {{MM-dd-yy HH:mm z}}

h3. Expected Results

The time stored on the database should be 09:01 GMT and will be displayed according to the end user's timezone settings.

h3. Actual Results

The time stored in the database is an hour behind (ie. 08:01 GMT). The incorrect time is displayed according to the end user's timezone settings.

Note : This  CSV time input (11-04-18 09:01 GMT}) coincides with the daylight switch on the default timezone configured:
{quote}
Los Angeles
4 Nov 2018 - Daylight Saving Time Ended 
When local daylight time was about to reach
Sunday, 4 November 2018, 02:00:00 clocks were turned backward 1 hour to
Sunday, 4 November 2018, 01:00:00 local standard time instead.
{quote}


h3. Workaround

Set the *Default user time zone* temporarily to System default GMT+0 and run the import
fields.summary: CSV import does not honor GMT timezone when coinciding with daylight switch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 - Perform migration from Jira Server to Jira Cloud, you will find few issues(all Epics) missing in the Kanban boards with no Backlog, and to fix this, you will have to remap the issue status to Kanban backlog and then back to its original status.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Perform migration of issues from Jira server to cloud.
 # You can notice in some of the projects, there are issues(of Epic Issuetype) missing.
 # Under Board settings > Columns > Status(case count will be correct) however, in the board, the issue count will not match.

For example, In the "To Do" status, you have 8cases, but in the board under the "To Do" column, you will find only 7cases. The missing case can be searched in the Global issue search only and not in the quick search.
h3. Expected Results
 - All the issues must be seen in the board's post-migration.

h3. Actual Results
 - Some of the issues(Epics) are missing from the board.

h3. Workaround

To fix a Board, you will have to move any status to the Kanban backlog column and then back to its original column. If many boards are affected, then reach out to Support team.
fields.summary: Post migration from Jira Server to Cloud, we found issues missing in Kanban board

fields.description:
Moved from: [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ACJIRA-2393]

 

There are a few ways to retrieve migration details. The first one is webhook data. The `createdAt` field is presented there as a timestamp, so it should be parsed in Java with `Instant.ofEpochSecond` method.

The second option is to use a rest request for recent migrations i.e.`/rest/atlassian-connect/1/migration/`. According to the [reference|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/app-migration/rest/api-group-transfer-retrieval-api/] the `createdAt` field is a number and it turned out that it is not a timestamp but epoch milliseconds, i.e. must be parsed with `Instant.ofEpochMillis`

It would be nice to have an explicitly specified time format for the rest call in the reference. Also, it would be nice to have it consistent with the webhook data.
fields.summary: Use consistent time format for createdAt field in the migration info

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira site import from server to a cloud site which already has data does not wipe off the work history (Profile > Worked on) still shows the activity happened in the projects which were present before the import.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Take a Jira server backup and import it in a cloud site which is having data already.
 # Go to Profile --> Worked on 
 # The activities which were recorded with the projects before the import is still visible.
 # The worked on activities is visible when when we do a blank site import

h3. Expected Results
 * Site import should clear the worked on activities as well along with projects.

h3. Actual Results
 * Worked on history is still visible after importing with blank Jira site import.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Jira site import does not clear the work history

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using CCMA - using option *Only users related to the selected spaces*, user accounts with duplicate email addresses are merged in the cloud site.

 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Tested with latest CCMA version 3.20
 # Created user *'test8'* with email *'sms2@atlassian.com'*, followed by user *'test7'*using the same email address.
 # Created a space named *7-space* using *test7.*
 # And created a new page *test7space-page* with user *test7* and edited the page and commented on it using first user test8.
 # Created another page with user test8.
 #  Migrated the space to the cloud site using option *Only users related to the selected spaces*, the migration completed successfully.

 
h3. Expected Results
 * Either the migration should fail or not be allowed to be run until all duplicates and invalids are fixed OR,
 * Customer should be provided an option so that he can choose which user the content should get merged to.

h3. Actual Results
 * We noticed that test8 user got migrated to the cloud site (because it was created first on the server than test7)
 * And all the content of test7 user got merged with test8 user.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Users with duplicate emails are merged when using CCMA

fields.description:
JMWE for Jira Cloud will offer a post-migration page that will list every JMWE workflow extension ("rule") that requires manual changes (changes that cannot be done automatically during the migration).
In order to build that page, we need to be able to identify workflows that contain JMWE workflow extensions that need changes. Unfortunately, while we could identify them during the migration, we have no place to save that information. We can't save it in our own storage because if the customer clones a workflow, we'll have no way of knowing that the workflow copy also requires changes.
On the other hand, we can't just go over each workflow and check each JMWE workflow extension while building the page, because the only available REST API for that can only return a few workflows at a time, with pagination, and we're talking about large payloads therefore slow REST calls, and some migrating customers have hundreds of workflows...
What we need is a way to "tag" workflows that require changes, and have that tag being copied along when cloning a workflow. Having workflow entity properties would work, but they don't currently exist (or at least there's not API for that). And of course we'd need a way to list workflows that have a particular workflow entity property value.

Another problem is that this REST API doesn't even allow getting the workflow rules only for one workflow, so even if we had the list of workflows requiring changes, we couldn't quickly get to the JMWE "rules" for a particular workflow, which is also a big issue when you have a lot of workflows (the only solution right now is to iterate through each page until we encounter the desired workflow)
fields.summary: Provide a way to tag workflow rules that need changes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Launching the migration assistant results in an error: "We can't communicate with your server. We're having trouble communicating with your server instance. Please try again. If this doesn't fix the issue. contact support for help"

h3.Environment
Server instance with 1000+ spaces

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an instance with more than 1000 spaces
# Launch the migration assistant

h3. Expected Results

The assistant loads and returns data on the spaces

h3. Actual Results

An exception like the one below is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
2021-04-30 00:42:19,813 WARN [SiteSummaryCalculator:thread-1] [hibernate.query.internal.QueryParameterBindingsImpl] doLogf HHH000443: Dialect [com.atlassian.migration.agent.store.jpa.impl.OracleDialect] limits the number of elements in an IN predicate to 1000 entries.  However, the given parameter list [keys] contained 3457 entries, which will likely cause failures to execute the query in the database

2021-04-30 00:42:19,965 ERROR [SiteSummaryCalculator:thread-1] [engine.jdbc.spi.SqlExceptionHelper] doLog ORA-01795: maximum number of expressions in a list is 1000

2021-04-30 00:42:19,967 ERROR [http-nio2-8011-exec-6] [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] toResponse Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: Failed to load server statistics
 -- referer: https://confluence.base.url/admin/migration.action | url: /rest/migration/latest/stats/server | traceId: 8c1944ae44e26d55 | userName: admin
com.atlassian.migration.agent.service.FailedToLoadStatsException: Failed to load server statistics
...
Caused by: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: javax.persistence.PersistenceException: org.hibernate.exception.SQLGrammarException: could not extract ResultSet
...
Caused by: java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: ORA-01795: maximum number of expressions in a list is 1000
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Migration assistant doesn't launch due to ORA-01795

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For Jira versions 8.15 and 8.16 when running a migration with JCMA, the migration fails and the log shows
{noformat}
12021-04-19 09:34:16.918 ERROR TP project-export We couldn't export Custom Field Config Scheme 'Default Configuration Scheme for Epic Status'. Reason: java.lang.NullPointerException.22021-04-19 09:34:17.130 ERROR TP project-export We couldn't export Custom Field Config Scheme 'Default Configuration Scheme for Epic Status'. Reason: java.lang.NullPointerException.
{noformat}
On those versions of Jira, no options for the Epic Status is created - therefore we don’t have a default value for that field based on the exception in the logs.

Migrations are successful when using Jira versions 8.14 or 8.17-EAP02. It doesn’t appear if you previously had an instance with 8.14 or earlier and upgraded to 8.15.

As the field is created in Jira Software there’s no way to set it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Project and add an Epic to the Project
 # Migrate a project with JCMA from a fresh Jira 8.15 or 8.16

h3. Expected Results

The Project should migrate without errors.

h3. Actual Results

The migration fails.

The log file contains this {{java.lang.NullPointerException}} stack trace. The migration log has the error shown above.
{noformat}
d9ac4e72f96e: Exporting referenced entities by Custom Field Config Scheme 10207 failed
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.core.customfield.CustomFieldConfigSchemeExporter.getDefaultValue(CustomFieldConfigSchemeExporter.kt:153)
	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.core.customfield.CustomFieldConfigSchemeExporter.exportCustomFieldDefaultValue(CustomFieldConfigSchemeExporter.kt:120)
	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.core.customfield.CustomFieldConfigSchemeExporter$childrenActions$3.invoke(CustomFieldConfigSchemeExporter.kt:62)
	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.core.customfield.CustomFieldConfigSchemeExporter$childrenActions$3.invoke(CustomFieldConfigSchemeExporter.kt:28)
	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.framework.ExportService.continueWithChildrenActions(ExportService.kt:219)
	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.framework.ExportService.exportByEntityImpl(ExportService.kt:208)
	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.framework.ExportService.exportOrThrow(ExportService.kt:111)
	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.framework.ExportService.exportOrThrow$default(ExportService.kt:105)
	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.core.customfield.CustomFieldExporter.mapCustomFieldConfigScheme(CustomFieldExporter.kt:77)
	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.core.customfield.CustomFieldExporter$childrenActions$1.invoke(CustomFieldExporter.kt:64)
	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.core.customfield.CustomFieldExporter$childrenActions$1.invoke(CustomFieldExporter.kt:19)
...
{noformat}

In Jira 8.14 for the default configuration scheme for epic status has

!image-2021-05-03-14-31-46-824.png|thumbnail!

Whereas in Jira 8.15 or 8.16 it has

!image-2021-05-03-14-32-25-312.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Remove the Duplicate Default Field Configuration Scheme and assign the default value for the Epic status as 'To do'
(!) *Always back up your data before performing any modifications to the database. If possible, test any alter, insert, update, or delete SQL commands on a staging server first.*
{panel}
 # Unlock the Epic Status custom field by referring [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-unlock-a-locked-field-779158866.html] page.
 # Open EPIC Status field and remove Duplicated Default Field Configuration Scheme (So project will be using EPIC status global context ) and assign the Default Value as 'To Do'
 # Lock EPIC status field.
 # Retry Migration{panel}
The final Epic Status Configuration page should be look like this,
 !custom_field_context.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JCMA export throws java.lang.NullPointerException. and "We couldn't export Custom Field Config Scheme 'Default Configuration Scheme for Epic Status'."

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When migrating from Server to Cloud via JCMA and asking JCMA to migrate only the users/groups related to projects getting moved over, migration may fail with a membership related error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup JCMA to migrate a few projects and select the option to use scoped Users/Groups.
 # Attempt to migrate.

h3. Expected Results
Migration goes through.

h3. Actual Results
It fails with the error below:
{noformat}
100:Memberships contain groups that are not part of groups being migrated. 
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Currently, JCMA has a bug in its Scoped Users/Groups migration that will cause JCMA to fail if any of the groups to be migrated has JSD/JSM only access.

To workaround this, one could leverage the URL below to see which groups will be migrated as part of a project scoped migration:
{code}
<BASE-URL>/rest/migration/latest/debug/export/users-groups?projectKeys=<PKEY>&mode=<REFERENCED>
{code}

Then with the list of groups, access one by one in Jira and check which ones have JSD/JSM access only. For those, the option is to either remove JSD/JSM access leaving the group without access to any apps or to add a JSW/Core access to the group.

Once that's done, re-try the migration and it should go through. :)
fields.summary: Migrating Jira Server to Cloud via JCMA with scoped users/groups fails due to membership related errors

fields.description:
Ideally, JCMA should allow for deltas to be migrated if a project fails during a migration plan. This will allow admins to re-run a migration without having to delete the project in Cloud and save time by only migrating the elements that failed.

The current proposed run book for failed projects is to delete in Cloud and remigrate, but this can pose some challenges if we're working with a large projects because:

1) Project deletions are long running tasks in Cloud and it can take hours to delete a project

2) Migration deadlines can be affected by having to remigrate X% of projects
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow for a retry mechanism that would only migrate deltas (missing items that failed on the first run). This will allow migrations to benefit from a faster migration in the case a project fails.
fields.summary: Allow JCMA to migrate deltas when a project migration fails

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

The new Atlassian App Migration Platform (currently under development) will enable all Atlassian Marketplace Partners apps to build automated migration paths for their apps.
h3. Suggested solution

fields.description:
JCMA Should prevent other Long Running and performance intensive operations from running simultaneously. JCMA is a fairly performance intensive app, so having other long running threads such as reindexing or XML backups can exhaust memory and cause severe memory pressure in the JVM Jira is running in. 

h3. Suggested Resolution
Do not allow JCMA to run while these operations are happening and prevent these operations from running while JCMA is actively migrating data.
fields.summary: JCMA Should prevent other Long Running and performance intensive operations from running simultaneously

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JRASERVER-71438 describes a problem with leading/trailing spaces in objects' names during an import.

This also can be a problem during a Server -> Cloud migration if you have objects (say an issue type) with a space in its name.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue type called '*Maintenance*_'_ in the Cloud
 # Create an issue type called '*Maintenance* _'_ in the Server (notice a trailing blank space)
 # Migrate Jira Server projects to the Cloud via JCMA

h3. Expected Results

Objects migrated.
h3. Actual Results

An error is thrown indicating a duplicate issue type.

The below exception is thrown in the Error log section under the Logs and reports UI, that's shown after the migration finishes:
{code:java}
2021-04-26 18:01:30.735 ERROR CRYP project-import We couldn't import Issue Type 'Maintenance '. Reason: IllegalArgumentException: Validation error: {IssueType=An issue type with this name already exists.}.
{code}
Notice the trailing space in the issue type name in the snippet above.

This error indicates that there's a duplicate Issue Type, whereas it shouldn't. 
 If you remove the trailing space in the Server issue type's name, this error won't surface anymore.
h3.  Workaround

The current manual workaround is to manually remove the trailing space in the Server before attempting the migration.

The suggestion here is that a check is implemented in the pre-migration validations. Example:
 * add a logic that removes the trailing space of the issue type so that it can figure out that '*Maintenance '* and '*Maintenance*' are the same issue type

*or*
 * add a step to the pre-migration check that fails if an issue type has a trailing space in its name and directs the user to correct it before starting the migration
fields.summary: Improve "check for errors" to avoid errors due to leading/trailing spaces

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When migrating using Jira Cloud Migration Assistant, if there are existing projects using the Default Field Configuration Scheme, custom fields such as Story Points which link to issue type Story will appear to be lost if the incoming projects being migrated also has an issue type Story.

This appears to be because while the incoming issue type will have the *(migrated)* value appended to the name, the Default Field Configuration Scheme will replace the existing one in Jira Cloud.

Existing projects that used the *Story* issue type will fail to show data post-migration (such as linked custom fields) because the new Default Field Configuration Scheme that was imported is linked only with the *Story (migrated)* issue type.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira Cloud project that utilizes the Default Field Configuration Scheme for an issue type like *Story*
 # Link the issue type to a custom field like *Story Points* where the value can be visible in the screen
# Create a project on Jira Server that also uses the Default Field Configuration Scheme for an issue type like *Story* that also links to a custom field *Story Points*
# Verify both projects have issues that are of type Story and have Story Points values associated with them
# Migrate the Jira Server project using JCMA

h3. Expected Results
Existing projects should show data as it appeared pre-migration before the incoming Jira Server project is migrated

h3. Actual Results
* A new Default Field Configuration Scheme is created with the description:
(Migrated on "Date of Migration")
* The new scheme contains a duplicate issue type *Story (migrated)*
* Existing projects associated with the Default Field Configuration Scheme will inherit this new issue type as the Global Context will be set for all projects
* Existing projects will appear to have missing data

h3. Workaround
In this particular scenario, the user can edit the Default Field Configuration Scheme and add the original issue type *Story* to the list in addition to the *Story (migrated)*. This will ensure existing projects and imported projects both have references to their exact issue type.
fields.summary: JCMA will migrate Default Field Configuration Scheme and replace existing one in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
The spirit of Atlassian's best practices, "don't do it for the first time in Production" does not apply to the Cloud Migration Assistants. This is broken. 

Best practice:
 # Create a clone of the Prod Server/Data Center instance
 # Set up a "Dev" Cloud instance
 # Install *CMA in your Dev Server/DC instance and connect it to the Cloud Dev instance
 # Identify a repeatable method of performing the migration
 # Export the configuration from your Dev *CMA App
 # Import the saved configuration in you Prod *CMA App
 # Perform the migration in Production for real

We need items 5 and 6. This is the ability to save the configuration and migrate it to the Production system after a repeatable method of migration has been determined.
fields.summary: JCMA/CCMA Export and Import saved configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customer can sometimes receive warning/error message "We are currently updating the migration service" in JCMA while running a migration plan.

!image_bug.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run a Migration Plan through JCMA;
 # When reviewing the Migration Checklist, admins running the assistant can receive the before-mentioned message.

h3. Expected Results

- The message "We are currently updating the migration service" should not appear, or in case the destination cloud site is for some reason unavailable/unreachable, a better/self-explanatory/complete message should be displayed to the customer running the migration plan, such as:

"<Destination Cloud Site> is unreachable at this moment. Please try again or contact the Migration Support in case the issue persists."

h3. Actual Results

Customers end up getting a really generic message "We are currently updating the migration service" that is not very helpful for an initial analysis.

h3. Workaround

Some workarounds that were found to be effective:
- Make sure you are using the correct JIRA's base url before migration;
- Please re-migrate the project by re-authenticating to the cloud instance (Jira server Administration > System > Migrate to cloud > Create new migration > Connect to cloud > click "Choose cloud site" button > click "Change Account" > re-enter the login credentials -> select cloud site);
fields.summary: "We are currently updating the migration service" message in JCMA

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When migrating Jira to cloud using the Cloud migration assistant if you don't have one product (Jira Core) or (Jira Software) the migration plan will fail, however, there is no error message in UI indicating the reason for the failure.

h3. Logs

In the atlassian-jira.log you will be able to see the following log excerpt:

{code}
2021-03-31 14:24:11,734+0000 pool-25-thread-7 INFO [c.a.j.m.tracking.polling.StatusPoller] Migration c7714344-a35b-4477-8897-e8f4ee39055e failed in stage user: 139:Groups contain permissions for products that do not exist on your cloud site. Enable Jira Core in your cloud site and try again.
{code}

 !Screen Shot 2021-03-31 at 11.36.30.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion

Improve error logging so it surfaces in the UI making easier to identify the reason behind this specific fail point.


h3. Workaround

In Cloud subscribe to Jira Core or Jira Software, this will depend on the type of projects and permissions you have on your server.
fields.summary: Improve log error for missing products in Cloud when using Jira Cloud Migration Assistant

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue status duplication due to server side configuration change. This leads to migration failures.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # By default the issue status on the server, 'To Do', is mapped to the category 'To Do'. (Status Category number 2).
 # On cloud the status, 'To Do', doesn't exist by default.
 # I migrate a project for the first time to the cloud instance and this leads to creation of the issue status 'To Do' on the cloud [To Do ----> To Do].
 # On the server, I will change the issue status category of 'To Do' ---> 'In Progress'.
 # I will perform a migration of another project and this creates a duplicate for the status, 'To Do(migrated)'.
 # Irrespective of the creation of duplicate status, the migration still fails with similar error below.

{panel}
2021-03-22 12:28:28.053 ERROR MACS project-import We couldn't import Issue MACS-1. Reason: NullPointerException: There is no step in workflow [Software Simplified Workflow for Project MACS] linked to status [To Do (migrated)]. This caused 4 other items to fail.
{panel}
h3. Expected Results

Not to create the duplication and synchronise with settings on the server.
h3. Actual Results

!Screenshot 2021-03-22 at 7.01.31 PM.png|width=616,height=49!
{panel}
2021-03-22 12:28:28.053 ERROR MACS project-import We couldn't import Issue MACS-1. Reason: NullPointerException: There is no step in workflow [Software Simplified Workflow for Project MACS] linked to status [To Do (migrated)]. This caused 4 other items to fail.
{panel}
h3. Workaround

Not known
fields.summary: Issue status duplication (To Do) leading to config drift and migration failure.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Cloud Migration Assistant creates Done status in other language in cloud if using non-English as default in server.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change your Jira system default language, for example, Japanese. The status remains same if you looking at status list screen.
 # Not related to if you choose English/Japanese profile. If you use a Japanese profile, the The status should be translated to Japanese(完了). However, if you edit the status, you can see it is still Done(or look at in DB, Done status was not changed).
 # Do a migration using JCMA

h3. Expected Results

It should be migrate to Done in cloud.
h3. Actual Results

It is migrated to 完了 (Done in Japanese) in cloud. If your system already has Done status, you may see two of them, in Japanese and English respectively.
h3. Workaround

Whichever below should work
 * Change default language to English during migration
fields.summary: Jira Cloud Migration Assistant creates Done status in other language in cloud if using non-English as default in server

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Projects that were previously archived in Server will show-up in Cloud as unarchived after a Server to Cloud migration.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Archive a project in Jira Server/Data Center following [these steps|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/archiving-a-project-938847621.html].
# Export your Jira Server to XML.
# Import your Jira Server XML into Jira Cloud.
# Search for any previously archived project.

h3. Expected Results
Projects should remain archived.

h3. Actual Results
Projects are showing as unarchived instead.

h3. Workaround
# Generate a list of archived projects in Server by running this query:
{code:sql}
select pe.property_key,p.* from propertyentry pe join project p on pe.entity_id=p.id where property_key = 'jira.archiving.projects';
{code}
# Leverage the script below to hit Jira Cloud API and re-archive affected spaces:
{code}
#!/bin/bash
cat projects.csv | while read line;
do
    projectkey=`echo $line | cut -d ',' -f1`
    echo "Archiving Project $groupname"
    curl -D- -u 'email@domain.com:API_TOKEN' -X https://address.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/$projectkey/archive
done
{code}

(!) Make sure to change site address, e-mail address and API token in the script above.
(!) The _projects.csv_ file should consist of project key(s) and project id(s) separated by a comma.
fields.summary: Archived projects are unarchived when migrating from Server to Cloud

*Problem Definition*

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Subtask show unsupported messages for sprint field in post migration report after migrating to cloud. It makes customer confusing.
{code:java}
Unsupported ABC5OPE Issue ABC5OPE-38 Custom field value The "Sprint" custom field is not supported via migration
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Migrate tickets linking with a Sprint, and the ticket has some subtask.

h3. Expected Results

No error report since sprint it supported by cloud migration, and sprint filed is actually set for those ticket after migration.
h3. Actual Results

Below message is written into Requires attention_Post-migration report for each subtask.
{code:java}
Unsupported	ABC5OPE	Issue	ABC5OPE-38	Custom field value	The "Sprint" custom field is not supported via migration. The value for this issue will not be migrated.	If you require this field value, use a csv import to update the issues post migration. See the 'Adding additional entities with CSV' section in this document: https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/what-gets-migrated-with-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-993925216.html
{code}
h3. Workaround

Ignore the message in post report if the sprint of ticket is set in cloud side.
fields.summary: Subtask show unsupported messages for sprint field in post migration report when migrating to cloud

fields.description:
h2. September, 22nd - Status Update:
 * JCMA App migration is being promoted to Public Beta.
 * Refer [our Cloud Migration Guide|https://zephyrdocs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CAPTURE/pages/3027501059/Capture+for+Jira+Server-to-Cloud+Migration+Guide] for instructions.
 * Capture JCMA migration support has been deployed.
 * The status of this ticket is now Closed Done.

h2. Problem Definition

Is your organization preparing for Atlassian's Journey to the Cloud? Are you preparing to migrate your Jira instance + Apps from Server (or Data Center) to Cloud?

Here is information to help you plan your migrations that include SmartBear's Capture.
h2. Primary Migration Solution: Jira Cloud Migration Assistant (JCMA)

The Atlassian Jira + App migration platform, known as the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant (JCMA), will be your primary solution for Cloud Migrations.

Here's what [Atlassian has to say about migrating your apps|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/platform/automated-app-migration]! 

GA of the [Atlassian JCMA for Apps|https://www.atlassian.com/roadmap/cloud?category=migrating&] is anticipated late 2021 ("Marketplace app migration")
h2. About the JCMA

The JCMA is an app (think of it as a platform) for migrating a Jira Server instance to a Jira Cloud instance. The migration happens all at once, synchronously. When a customer migrates from Jira Server/DataCenter, to Jira Cloud, using the JCMA, the app migration platform will programmatically migrate Capture for Jira, and associated data from Server/DC to Cloud at the same time that it migrates your Jira instance.

Atlassian designed the JCMA in such a way that Marketplace Partners (such as SmartBear) build their app migration support on top of the JCMA. Therefore, when a customer migrates using the JCMA, the Jira instance is migrated to Cloud and then all the supported apps are migrated, all at the same time.

Capture migration development for the JCMA is complete. To migrate your Jira instance + Capture, you must follow our [Cloud Migration Guide.|https://zephyrdocs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CAPTURE/pages/3027501059/Capture+for+Jira+Server-to-Cloud+Migration+Guide]

*We recommend our customers to raise* *a Migration support ticket with Atlassian* [*here*|https://support.atlassian.com/contact] while mentioning their plan to migrate Jira Server/DC data along with Zephyr Squad to Cloud.

By doing so, you will contact the Cloud Migration Managers (CMM) from Atlassian and they will loop ours in the same ticket. Through Atlassian Migration Support (_*MOVE*_) ticket, you will get a better understanding of the available migration paths, the risks involved, and other relevant information.

Additional information can be found online at SmartBear:

Migration Status:

[https://zephyrdocs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CAPTURE/pages/3027501059/Capture+for+Jira+Server-to-Cloud+Migration+Guide]
fields.summary: Support Migration for: Capture for Jira

fields.description:
h2. September, 22nd - Status Update:
 * JCMA App migrations is being promoted to Public Beta.
 * Customers willing to migrate must [contact Zephyr Scale Support|https://smartbear.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/42] and ask to enable your target Cloud instance for data migration on our side.
 * Refer [our Cloud Migration Guide|https://support.smartbear.com/zephyr-scale-server/docs/cloud-migration-guide.html] for instructions.
 * Zephyr Scale JCMA migration support has been deployed.
 * The status of this ticket is now Closed Done.

h2. Problem Definition

Is your organization preparing for Atlassian's Journey to the Cloud? Are you preparing to migrate your Jira instance + Apps from Server (or Data Center) to Cloud?

Here is information to help you plan your migrations that include SmartBear's Zephyr Scale (formerly known as: TM4J).
h2. Primary Migration Solution: Jira Cloud Migration Assistant (JCMA)

 
 The Atlassian Jira + App migration platform, known as the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant (JCMA), will be our primary solution for Cloud Migrations.
  
 GA of the [Atlassian JCMA for Apps|https://www.atlassian.com/roadmap/cloud?category=migrating&] is anticipated late 2021 ("Marketplace app migration").
  
 Here are the steps for migrating Zephyr Scale data using the JCMA:
 # Follow Atlassian's guide for the [JCMA installation|https://support.atlassian.com/migration/docs/use-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-to-migrate].
 # Raise a [General Request with SmartBear|https://smartbear.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/42] to enable Zephyr Scale's migration.
 # Follow [Zephyr Scale guide|https://support.smartbear.com/zephyr-scale-server/docs/cloud-migration-guide.html] for Server-to-Cloud migration.
h2. About the JCMA

The JCMA is an app (think of it as a platform) for migrating a Jira Server instance to a Jira Cloud instance. The migration happens all at once, synchronously. When a customer migrates from Jira Server/DataCenter, to Jira Cloud, using the JCMA, the app migration platform will programmatically migrate Zephyr Scale - Test Management for Jira, and associated data from Server/DC to Cloud at the same time that it migrates your Jira instance.

Atlassian designed the JCMA in such a way that Marketplace Partners (such as SmartBear) build their app migration support on top of the JCMA. Therefore, when a customer migrates using the JCMA, the Jira instance is migrated to Cloud and then all the supported apps are migrated, all at the same time.

Zephyr migration development for the JCMA is complete. To migrate your Jira instance + Zephyr Scale, you must follow above steps. 

*We recommend our customers to raise* *a Migration support ticket with Atlassian* [*here*|https://support.atlassian.com/contact] while mentioning their plan to migrate Jira Server/DC data along with Zephyr Scale to Cloud

By doing so, you will contact the Cloud Migration Managers (CMM) from Atlassian and they will loop ours in the same ticket. Through Atlassian Migration Support (_*MOVE*_) ticket, you will get a better understanding of the available migration paths, the risks involved, and other relevant information.
h2. Additional Migration Information

The SmartBear-Zephyr team is also collecting additional requirements from existing DC/Server customers for consideration in the JCMA.
h4. Additional information can be found online at SmartBear:

Migration Status:

[https://support.smartbear.com/zephyr-scale-server/docs/cloud-migration-guide.html] 

Zephyr Scale, Features: Server/Data Center vs Cloud

[https://support.smartbear.com/zephyr-scale-server/docs/features.html]

fields.description:
h2. September, 22nd - Status Update:
 * JCMA App migration is being promoted to Public Beta
 * Refer [our Cloud Migration Guide|https://support.smartbear.com/zephyr-squad-server/docs/get-started/cloud-migration-guide/index.html] for instructions.
 * Zephyr Squad JCMA migration support has been deployed.
 * The status of this ticket is now Closed Done.

h2. Problem Definition

Is your organization preparing for Atlassian's Journey to the Cloud? Are you preparing to migrate your Jira instance + Apps from Server (or Data Center) to Cloud?

Here is information to help you plan your migrations that include SmartBear's Zephyr Squad (formerly known as: Zephyr for Jira).
h2. Primary Migration Solution: Jira Cloud Migration Assistant (JCMA)

The Atlassian Jira + App migration platform, known as the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant (JCMA), will be your primary solution for Cloud Migrations.

Here's what [Atlassian has to say about migrating your apps|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/platform/automated-app-migration]!

GA of the [Atlassian JCMA for Apps|https://www.atlassian.com/roadmap/cloud?category=migrating&] is anticipated late 2021 ("Marketplace app migration")
h2. About the JCMA

The JCMA is an app (think of it as a platform) for migrating a Jira Server instance to a Jira Cloud instance. The migration happens all at once, synchronously. When a customer migrates from Jira Server/DataCenter, to Jira Cloud, using the JCMA, the app migration platform will programmatically migrate Zephyr Squad - Zephyr for Jira, and associated data from Server/DC to Cloud at the same time that it migrates your Jira instance.

Atlassian designed the JCMA in such a way that Marketplace Partners (such as SmartBear) build their app migration support on top of the JCMA. Therefore, when a customer migrates using the JCMA, the Jira instance is migrated to Cloud and then all the supported apps are migrated, all at the same time.

Zephyr migration development for the JCMA is complete. To migrate your Jira instance + Zephyr Squad, you must follow our [Cloud Migration Guide via JCMA|https://support.smartbear.com/zephyr-squad-server/docs/get-started/cloud-migration-guide/via-jcma.html].

*We recommend our customers to raise* *a Migration support ticket with Atlassian* [*here*|https://support.atlassian.com/contact] while mentioning their plan to migrate Jira Server/DC data along with Zephyr Squad to Cloud.

By doing so, you will contact the Cloud Migration Managers (CMM) from Atlassian and they will loop ours in the same ticket. Through Atlassian Migration Support (_*MOVE*_) ticket, you will get a better understanding of the available migration paths, the risks involved, and other relevant information.
h2. Secondary Migration Solution: Zephyr Migration Tool

For Customers looking for a migration solution sooner that GA, or an alternative method, then you will be pleased to know [our Zephyr Migration Open-Source tool|https://support.smartbear.com/zephyr-squad-server/docs/get-started/cloud-migration-guide/via-open-source-tool.html].
h2. Additional Migration Information

The SmartBear-Zephyr team is also collecting additional requirements from existing DC/Server customers for consideration in the JCMA.
h4. Additional information can be found online at SmartBear:

Migration Status:

[https://support.smartbear.com/zephyr-squad-server/docs/get-started/cloud-migration.html] 

Zephyr for Jira, Features: Server/Data Center vs Cloud

[https://support.smartbear.com/zephyr-squad-server/docs/get-started/features.html]
fields.summary: Support Migration for: Zephyr Squad (fka: Zephyr for Jira)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The new Atlassian App Migration Platform (currently under development) will enable all Atlassian Marketplace Partners apps to build automated migration paths for their apps.
h3. Current Status

NEW APIs are active and available today! No migration is required. Read below.
h3. Solution
h4. Subject: Zephyr for Jira Cloud 7.1.1 Release - End of Support for ZAPI, Jenkins and Bamboo plugins

Now you can import test results from test automation frameworks directly into Zephyr with the revamped Test Automation Integration (formerly A.T.O.M.) It is important to update to the latest version to support these changes.
h4. What will change?

Zephyr for Jira is no longer supporting the the ZAPI, Jenkins and Bamboo plugins. The latest release includes built-in REST APIs, scripts for integrating with Jenkins/Bamboo and native BDD/Cucumber support.
h4. What does this mean?

Your existing integrations need to be transitioned to the new offerings to avoid disruption. Please find more information at the following:

Bamboo: [https://zephyrdocs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ZFJCLOUD/pages/1997438994/Bamboo+Integration] 

Jenkins: [https://zephyrdocs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ZFJCLOUD/pages/1996685380/Jenkins+Integration] 

REST API: [https://zephyrdocs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ZFJCLOUD/pages/1925120024/REST+API] 

BDD: [https://zephyrdocs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ZFJCLOUD/pages/1250558034/Zephyr+BDD+Feature]

Test Automation: [https://zephyrdocs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ZFJCLOUD/pages/1234960420/Test+Automation] 
h4. Why are we ending support for the ZAPI, Jenkins and Bamboo plugins?

With this release there is no more dependence on ZAPI for any API's to function, Zephyr currently supports all API's natively without the need to install ZAPI.

Zephyr for Jira integrations with BDD/Cucumber and modern test automations tools unlocks continuous testing throughout the software development lifecycle reducing the feedback loop and costs associated to testing.
h4. What happens if I don't take action?

If no action is taken and users continue to keep the ZAPI add-on, there will be no impact/issues, as the dependency of REST API with the add-on has been removed. The REST API's will continue to function as earlier. However, we recommend users to uninstall the ZAPI add-on from the Jira instances, as when the add-on is removed from the Atlassian marketplace, the Jira instance will hit a 404 Not found error. 
 
For Jenkins and Bamboo, when the plugins are removed, the configuration options will not be present to publish the results into Zephyr for Jira. Users will have to use the post build scripts provided as part of the Continuous Integration.

How can I get more information?

Check out the release notes [here|https://zephyrdocs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ZFJCLOUD/pages/21757974/All+Release+Notes].
fields.summary: Support Migration for ZAPI, Zephyr for Jira Plugin for Jenkins, Zephyr for Jira Add-on for Bamboo,

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
It would be great if we could recreate the Jira links in Confluence pages after a migration. 

h3. Steps to reproduce
* Migrate JIRA data with Site-import
* Migrate Confluence spaces with Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant
* Engage Atlassian Support to fix remotelinks in Jira.

h3. Expected Behavior
* After the remote links are fixed in Jira, the reciprocal links shows up in Confluence pages

h3. Actual Behavior
* After the remote links are fixed in Jira, the reciprocal links does not show up in Confluence pages. 

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Jira Links in Confluence pages are not migrated with Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to progress with the migration after having selected the destination cloud and source server site on the "Choose your destination cloud site" screen, if the product access groups are not reviewed in the destination cloud site, the "Confirm" button will not move forward with the request.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Do not approve the default groups for "Product access" on Confluence Cloud
* Use the CCMA to perform an import to the same cloud site;

h3. Expected Results
CCMA will display an error message/warning that the groups should be reviewed on the cloud site.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing will happen.

h3. Workaround
Review the groups on the "Product access" page in the UM.

h3. Notes
It's possible to see the following response for a 400 status code:
{code}{
  "code": 3013,
  "message": "The default group is missing or unapproved. Please check your cloud site and try again."
}{code}
fields.summary: CCMA - Clicking on the button "Confirm" on the "Choose your destination cloud site" screen when product access groups have not been configured on the destination will not proceed with the migration

h3. Issue Summary

Similar to MIG-52 but caused by a timeout rather than an explicit invalid email

Import with Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence fails if timeout is hit on InviteUserIdentityPlatformCommand
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence app to migrate
 # Timeout is hit 

h3. Expected Results

Space import proceed or if a timeout is hit, a retry is done. 
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.v2.ImportExportException: com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.v2.ImportExportException: com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.v2.ImportExportException: java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to call to IDP to invite user
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.v2.space.ImportSpaceProcessor.processImport(ImportSpaceProcessor.java:156)
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.v2.space.ImportSpaceProcessor.processImport(ImportSpaceProcessor.java:67)


Caused by: com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.v2.ImportExportException: com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.v2.ImportExportException: java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to call to IDP to invite user
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.v2.xml.ImportXmlDataExtractor.runImportForOneSpace(ImportXmlDataExtractor.java:225)


Caused by: com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.v2.ImportExportException: java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to call to IDP to invite user
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.v2.ImportProcessor.processFileImport(ImportProcessor.java:320)


Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to call to IDP to invite user
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.DefaultEmailAaidMapper.invite(DefaultEmailAaidMapper.java:97)


Caused by: com.netflix.hystrix.exception.HystrixRuntimeException: InviteUserIdentityPlatformCommand timed-out and no fallback available.

Caused by: java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException: 
com.netflix.hystrix.AbstractCommand.handleTimeoutViaFallback(AbstractCommand.java:997)
com.netflix.hystrix.AbstractCommand.access$500(AbstractCommand.java:60)
com.netflix.hystrix.AbstractCommand$12.call(AbstractCommand.java:609)

{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Retrying the migration might help
fields.summary: Space Import to Confluence Cloud might fail with 'Failed to call to IDP to invite user' timeout

fields.description:
Automation for Jira Cloud doesn't currently support third-party integrations which blocks Server and DC customers from migrating to Cloud and adopting apps they rely on currently.

Customers of our Better PDF Exporter and Better Excel Exporter Server and DC apps (both Tier 2 apps in Atlassian's terms) are signaling that they rely on the automation counterparts our these apps currently, and can't migrate to the Cloud versions of these apps if automation is not available or they will postpone the migration decision until progress is made.

Please enable 3rd party actions in Automation for Jira so we can unblock the cloud migration path for our server and DC customers.
h4. Related tickets

CLOUD-10966
h4. Mentioned Marketplace apps

[Better PDF Automation for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1212108/better-pdf-automation-for-jira?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview]

[Better Excel Automation for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1212797/better-excel-automation-for-jira?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview]
fields.summary: Support third-party actions in Automation for Jira Cloud

fields.description:
At the moment, it just shows that the plan failed and an admin has to manually scan the list of spaces to spot he failures. This is especially time consuming when you have hundreds of spaces to migrate

 
h3. Suggested Solution

Add a more robust summary of the migration plan that includes additional details such as number of spaces that failed.
fields.summary: Show the number of spaces that failed to migrate after a migration plan completes

fields.description:
With the new user interface changes in CCMA e.g. version 3.1.7, the order in which spaces process do not seem to have a set order (e.g. alphabetical). This makes it hard for admins to visually inspect space progress, especially when migrating hundreds of spaces.
h3. Suggested Solution

Make CCMA process spaces from the top down alphabetically rather than randomly:

!image-2021-02-25-17-40-55-316.png|width=884,height=138!
fields.summary: Improve the order in which CCMA processes spaces

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sandbox data cloning fails in user and group sync process.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Some of the sites when attempted for sandbox cloning fails at user and group sync process

 # Step 2

h3. Expected Results

Sandbox cloning should work
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in splunk
{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Duplicate key ex_user
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Use conventional site export import as the workaround. After the export is complete, remove the duplicate user from entities.xml file and then run the site import.
fields.summary: Sandbox import failing due to duplicate user key
